summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 19, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of routine monitoring log from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring at MCC NY SHU
events.description: Staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York's Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observational checks on inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation throughout the day.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 19, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs are from the same facility and time period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated.
Multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the Special Housing Unit are referenced, indicating a standardized monitoring system.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
